The mini-max criterion assumes a high-risk aversion approach to selecting a strategy to avoid extreme adverse outcomes, but there is a possibility that the chosen strategy is disproportionately influenced by extreme cases. The second approach (a variant of the domain criterion) is less sensitive to the extremes. This methodology, called Robust Decision Making
43 has been successfully applied in similar settings related to water and wastewater management, and flood risk assessments to support decision making under high levels of uncertainty
